Profile              
An assertive an d driven Process Engineer with  experience working on a variety of projects within the 
Potable Water  and the Oil and Gas  Industry .  Currently looking for a new position to enhance  my 
experience  in a role where I can utilise my skills and knowledge  to make a meaningful contribution to 
solve both business  and climate  challenges . 
 
Education

10 Lindsay Gardens, Gilletts Lane, High Wycombe, HP12 4BB   
james.ratcliffe95@gmail.com   07837122546   linkedin.com/in/ james -r95 
 
Profile              
An assertive an d driven Process Engineer with  experience working on a variety of projects within the 
Potable Water  and the Oil and Gas  Industry .  Currently looking for a new position to enhance  my 
experience  in a role where I can utilise my skills and knowledge  to make a meaningful contribution to 
solve both business  and climate  challenges . 
 
Education             
2013–2017  The University of Sheffield  
MEng (Hons) Che mical Engineering              Obtained Result: 1st 
Research Project:  
• Developing low cost and renewable heterogeneous cata lysts for biodiesel production . 
• Synthesised  and optimised  various catalysts and developed  and trialed  a scale up procedure . 
Design Project:  
• Designed a bioethanol fermentation and separation plant in a team of engineers, 
incorpor ating novel microbubble distillation and condensation  technology . Independently 
produced deliverables for the detailed design of the fermentation unit and plant layout.  
2006–2013  Macclesfield High School/ College  
  A Level s – Mathematics (B), Chemistry (B), Biology (B)  
  AS Level s – Product Design (B)  
  GCSE s – 14 (2A*, 6A, 6B) including Maths and English  
Relevant  Experience            
Aug 2019  – Present   Process  Engineer – Wood PLC  
Developed my core process engineering competencies on two world scale FEED project s; designing 
a Natural Gas Fractionation facility to be built in the Middle East  and a separate PMC role on a project  
to design a n olefin complex in Belgium.   Currently d eveloping a company -wide framework for 
embedding  sustainab ility and reliab ility within  infrastructure projects.  
• Performed process adequacy studies on two existing NGL fractionation facilities to process a 
change in feed composition and capacity; developing pro cess simulations to benchmark 
against equipment design and identify inadequacies.  
• Developed  and reviewed key engineering deliverables , such as; Basis of Design (BOD) , 
Process Flow Diagrams ( PFD), Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams ( P&ID ) and Datasheets . 
• Performed several technology evaluation process  studies , including;  licensed sulphur removal 
units  for various feeds  and a detailed  Spent Caustic Treatment Technology evaluation . 
• HAZOP scribed (remotely) for several different process areas , including license r units, 
producing HAZOP reports and implementing outcome actions.  
• Performed utility system configuration studies due to major reconfiguration of project scope.  
Sept 2017 – Aug 2019  Graduate Engineer – Affinity Water  
Gained valuable experience u ndertaking a range of  roles and projects within a graduate scheme.  
Process Optimisation P roject  
• Lead a process optimisation project assessing  the performance of  a potable  water treatment 
site in terms of operating costs, process and product quality.  Established a methodology that 
has been adopted as the standard approach by other  optimisation engineers . 
• Produced a series of solutions to mitigate inefficiencies concerning p ower, product quality and 
waste production, e.g. installing a bypass to reduce waste product and power usage.  
• Performed process modelling through mass/flow balances to simulate scenarios to quantify 
savings and understand the risk of identified potential  optimisation s. 
• Performed onsite tests (jar tests) to assess the performance of the sludge separating units 
and i nitiated a trial to assess a novel rotary sludge thickening unit to reduce waste volumes.  
• Provided onsite technical support to operators continuing the maintenance of optimal settings.  
HS2 Water Treatment Project  
• Working on the design and installation of ultra-filtration treatment plants within the HS2  
process  design team.  
• Reviewing design drawings  and documents,  including P&IDs, PFDs , mass  balances and 
control philosophies,  ensuring they comply with company standards.   
• Performing hydraulic design calculations for pump sizing.  
Energy Strategy P roj

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
